user.title: Connect to Rinnai Control-R
user.description: Choose how to connect to your Rinnai water heater.

data_description.connection_mode: Cloud uses your Rinnai account. Local connects directly to the water heater. Hybrid uses local with cloud fallback.

cloud.title: Cloud Connection
cloud.description: Enter your Rinnai Control-R account credentials.

data_description.email: The email address used for your Rinnai Control-R account
data_description.save_password: If enabled, your password will be stored to automatically re-authenticate when your session expires. If disabled, you will need to manually re-authenticate when your session expires.

local.title: Local Connection
local.description: Enter the IP address of your Rinnai water heater controller. The controller must be on your local network and accessible on port {port}.

data_description.host: IP address of your Rinnai water heater controller (e.g., 192.168.1.100)

hybrid_cloud.title: Hybrid Mode - Cloud Credentials
hybrid_cloud.description: First, enter your Rinnai Control-R account credentials for cloud fallback.

data_description.email: The email address used for your Rinnai Control-R account
data_description.save_password: If enabled, your password will be stored to automatically re-authenticate when your session expires. If disabled, you will need to manually re-authenticate when your session expires.

hybrid_local.title: Hybrid Mode - Local Connection
hybrid_local.description: Now enter the IP address of your Rinnai water heater controller for primary local control.

data_description.host: IP address of your Rinnai water heater controller (e.g., 192.168.1.100)

reauth.title: Re-authenticate with Rinnai Control-R
reauth.description: Your session has expired. Please re-enter your credentials.

data_description.save_password: If enabled, your password will be stored to automatically re-authenticate when your session expires. If disabled, you will need to manually re-authenticate when your session expires.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Rinnai Control-R
reconfigure.description: Change the connection mode or update the local host address.

data_description.connection_mode: Cloud uses your Rinnai account. Local connects directly to the water heater. Hybrid uses local with cloud fallback.
data_description.host: IP address of your Rinnai water heater controller (required for Local and Hybrid modes)

reconfigure_cloud.title: Cloud Credentials Required
reconfigure_cloud.description: The selected mode requires cloud access. Enter your Rinnai Control-R account credentials.

data_description.email: The email address used for your Rinnai Control-R account
data_description.save_password: If enabled, your password will be stored to automatically re-authenticate when your session expires. If disabled, you will need to manually re-authenticate when your session expires.

error.host_required: Host IP address is required for Local and Hybrid modes
error.local_connection_failed: Unable to connect to Rinnai controller at the specified IP address. Please verify: (1) The IP address is correct, (2) Port 9798 is accessible, (3) The controller is powered on. If local connection is not possible, please use Cloud mode instead.
error.hostname_resolution_failed: Unable to resolve hostname. Hostnames like 'rinnai-control-r.local' often fail in containerized environments. Please use the device's IP address instead (check your router's DHCP lease table).
error.user_not_confirmed: Your email address has not been confirmed. Please check your email and confirm your Rinnai account before continuing.
error.password_change_required: You must change your password in the Rinnai app before continuing. Please update your password and try again.

reauth_required.title: Rinnai authentication expired
reauth_required.description: Your session has expired and you must re-authenticate to continue using the Rinnai integration. Please reconfigure the integration from the Integrations page.

init.title: Rinnai Control-R Options
init.description: Configure options for your Rinnai water heater.

data_description.maint_interval_enabled: When enabled, retrieves detailed maintenance data from the device at the specified interval. This may increase API usage.
data_description.maint_interval_minutes: How often to retrieve maintenance data from the device (in minutes). Lower values provide more frequent updates but increase API usage. Only available for Local and Hybrid connection modes.
data_description.recirculation_duration: Duration in minutes (5-300) used by the Recirculation switch entity when turned on.

start_recirculation.name: Start recirculation
start_recirculation.description: Start water recirculation for a specified duration.

device_unavailable.message: The Rinnai device is currently unavailable
